channel.title: Code on Aesvoy
channel.description: Recent content in Code on Aesvoy

item.title: Sir Isaac Newton
item.author: sciredomir@tutanota.com (Mahan)
item.description: Sir Isaac Newton, born on December 25, 1642, in Woolsthorpe, England, is often regarded as one of the most influential scientists in history. His interest in Alchemy and Theology led him to explore the intersection of science and philosophy, ultimately shaping the scientific methodology and philosophical outlook.

item.title: Pioneers of Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence
item.author: sciredomir@tutanota.com (Mahan)
item.description: The journey of pioneers in Machine Learning (ML) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) is a remarkable tale of innovation, collaboration, and the relentless pursuit of knowledge.

item.title: Salient Object Detection
item.author: sciredomir@tutanota.com (Mahan)
item.description: Salient object detection (SOD) is a crucial task in computer vision that focuses on identifying and segmenting the most visually distinctive objects or regions within an image. The primary aim of SOD is to mimic human visual attention, allowing algorithms to highlight areas that are likely to attract a viewer’s focus.
